medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe headache and loss of peripheral vision.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began 4 weeks prior to admission with the elective termination of pregnancy. Three weeks later, pain in the left upper quadrant, vaginal bleeding, and headache developed. Severe bifrontal headache and loss of vision in the left visual field developed 4 days before the hospital admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic back pain related to a vertebral disk herniation, for which she underwent spinal-fusion surgery 4 years before admission. Two episodes of self-limited thrombocytopenia in the past 3 years, thought to be associated with methotrexate treatment for an unknown skin disorder. A 2-year history of waxing-and-waning dull epigastric pain associated with nausea and occasional episodes of bilious emesis.
medical_history.social_history: Lives in coastal New England, works in communications. Drinks alcohol occasionally and smokes less than 1 pack of cigarettes per week; she had not smoked during the past few months. No use of illicit drugs, over-the-counter medications, or herbal medications.
